translation: All glory to the beautiful ārati to Śrī Gorāchā̐d in a grove on the banks of the Ganges, which attracts the hearts of all souls throughout the world!
On Gorāchā̐d’s right is Nitāichā̐d, and on His left is Gadādhar. Advaita is nearby, and Śrīvās holds an umbrella.
Gorāchā̐d has sat on a jewelled throne. Brahmā and the other demigods worship Him (in the company of His devotees).

text: (sañjaya mukunda vāsu-ghoṣa gaura guṇa gāna kare)
translation: Narahari and others fan the Lord with chāmaras. Sañjay, Mukunda, Vāsudev Ghoṣ, and others sing.

text: (kibā) śaṅkha bāje ghaṇṭā bāje bāje karatāla
(gaurāṅger ārati kāle madhur madhur madhur bāje)
(śaṅkha bāje ghaṇṭā bāje madhur madhur madhur bāje)
(madhura mṛdanga bāje madhur madhur madhur bāje)
translation: Conches, bells, kartāls, and mṛdaṅgas resound sweetly. The kīrtan is most relishable.

text: (gaura gale vana phuler mālā jhalmal jhalmal jhalmal kare)
translation: The radiance of the Lord’s face surpasses that of millions of moons. The garland of forest flowers around His neck shines.
Śiva, Śukadev, and Nārad stammer in the ecstasy of love. In this way Bhakti Vinod beholds Gorāchā̐d’s glory.

text: (ṭhākura śrī bhakti-vinoda ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
(ṭhākura śrī sarasvatī ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
(patit-pāvan śrī gurudev ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
(sapārṣada gaurahari ei bār āmāy dayā kara)
translation: This time please give me your grace. O Śrīla Bhakti Vinod Ṭhākur, O Śrīla Saraswatī Ṭhākur, O Gurudev, saviour of the fallen, O Gaurahari, along with your associates, this time please give me your grace.
